meanings.definition: To make something free from bacteria or other microorganisms.
meanings.sent1: She was sterilizing the surgical tools to ensure they were clean for the operation.
meanings.sent2: The hospital staff followed strict protocols for sterilizing medical equipment.
meanings.sent3: The chef joked that he was sterilizing the kitchen so well, even the bacteria were wearing tiny hazmat suits.
meanings.sent4: The intense heat of the autoclave was like a warrior sterilizing all germs in its path.
meanings.sent5: The UV light was so effective at sterilizing the water that not a single microorganism survived.

meanings.definition: To make something unable to produce offspring.
meanings.sent1: The veterinarian recommended sterilizing the stray cat to prevent overpopulation.
meanings.sent2: The animal shelter offers a program for sterilizing pets to control the pet population.
meanings.sent3: The farmer accidentally ended up sterilizing the wrong sheep, leading to some unexpected peace and quiet.
meanings.sent4: The scientist's discovery of a plant extract capable of sterilizing insects amazed the entomology community.
meanings.sent5: The potion had a mysterious effect, sterilizing all creatures that drank it, leaving the forest eerily silent.

meanings.definition: To make something free from living organisms.
meanings.sent1: The process of sterilizing the soil involved using heat to kill all bacteria and fungi.
meanings.sent2: The laboratory technician was responsible for sterilizing the culture samples before testing.
meanings.sent3: The janitor took pride in sterilizing the entire room, making sure no living thing remained.
meanings.sent4: The chemical solution was so effective at sterilizing the surface that not even a single bacterium survived.
meanings.sent5: The spaceship's advanced technology was capable of sterilizing the spacecraft to prevent contamination of other planets.
